result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathon Robert Butterfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.02(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause. No possession of lighters, matches, accelerants or gasoline unless is the gas tank of a vehicle. No contact with Family Options Counseling or the building at 3015 N. 114th St.  No contact with James B.
Cooperate with the Department of Corrections. Write letter of apology to James B.
Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  Mental Health Evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.
Pay restitution in the amount of $5,879.28 to James B.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA an analysis surcharge. Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections. Pay all costs, fees, assessments and restitution, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: This time is stayed to be used for sanctions for any violations of probation.  If found with fire accelerants, Court orders defendant to serve a minimum of 30 days in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME.

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

records.addlTxt:
DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
( x ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  12/14/14
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Jonathon Robert Butterfield in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the Court.  Additional statements by:  Jennifer B.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 5 days served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 3 YEARS to the Mental Health Unit with the following conditions:
- As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 90 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed to be used for sanctions for any violations of probation.  If found with fire accelerants, Court orders defendant to serve a minimum of 30 days in the House of Correction, STRAIGHT TIME.
- No new violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with the Department of Corrections.
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  Mental Health Evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.
- No possession of lighters, matches, accelerants or gasoline unless is the gas tank of a vehicle.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
- No contact with Family Options Counseling or the building at 3015 N. 114th St.
- Pay restitution in the amount of $5,879.28 to James B.
- No contact with James B.
- Write letter of apology to James B.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay DNA an analysis surcharge.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and restitution, any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed; copy to defendant.

Defendant Jonathon Robert Butterfield in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 34.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed. cmt
Defendant Jonathon Robert Butterfield in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  kmw

Defendant Jonathon Robert Butterfield in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Patrick Kaine-Wauwatosa Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/29/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  Court orders that the defendant comply with all rules of any facility the defendant is placed in.  Court orders the defendant possess no flammable objects (matches, accelerants, lighters, etc.).    Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 3015 North 114th Street, Milwaukee, WI or Cassidy T.B.

Defendant Jonathon Robert Butterfield in court with attorney Debra J Patterson.  Defendant Jonathon Robert Butterfield in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. eam
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
